Through original programming, documentaries, and expert-led discussions, MHTN aims to increase awareness, provide valuable information, and encourage open conversations about mental well-being.

programme.title: Quo Vadis TV
programme.desc: Quo Vadis TV is committed to sharing the Biblical message in a way that makes Christian living practical, realistic, and attainable. Our theme is summarized the question: "where are you going?" Our Aim with this inquiry is to help people find orientation and find the path back to God.

Our theme is summarized the question: "where are you going?" Our Aim with this inquiry is to help people find orientation and find the path back to God.

programme.title: Tiny and Tough - The Incredible Resilience of Tardigrades

Plus, we discover Libreville through the eyes of artist Corail King.

programme.title: Jubal
programme.desc: Searching for work, cowboy Jubal Troop (Glenn Ford) arrives in a small town, where he badly injures his hand. Fortunately, a local rancher, Shep Horgan (Ernest Borgnine), is willing to employ Troop despite the injury. Horgan and Troop work together amicably, but Horgan's two-timing wife (Valerie French) threatens to create discord when she becomes interested in Troop, although he really loves another woman. A jealous cowhand (Rod Steiger) complicates matters by spreading lies.

programme.title: The First Time
programme.desc: A young married couple, Joe (Robert Cummings) and Betsey Bennet (Barbara Hale), are parents-to-be, expecting their first child. When the day arrives, the two frantically race to the hospital -- even smashing into a few trash cans along the way. With the delivery a success, Joe and Betsey get to discover what it's truly like being parents, beginning with the hospital bill. As the demands on their patience, wallets and time increase, Joe and Betsey are on the edge and close to falling off.

programme.title: Run Silent, Run Deep
programme.desc: After Japanese forces torpedo his submarine during World War II, commanding officer "Rich" Richardson (Clark Gable) is placed in charge of the USS Nerka. The crew on board the Nerka -- led by Lieutenant Jim Bledsoe (Burt Lancaster), who had been passed over for promotion when Richardson was brought in -- is openly hostile to their new commander, especially when it becomes clear that Richardson's sole obsession is finding and destroying the Japanese ship that sank his old vessel.

programme.title: Gasoline Alley
programme.desc: A black-sheep cousin of Corky's wife causes nothing but trouble for the Wallet family, as they try to devise a way to send him packing.

programme.title: My Dear Secretary
programme.desc: When romance writer Owen Waterbury (Kirk Douglas) meets Stephanie Steve Gaylord (Laraine Day), he offers her a job as his secretary. Steve, a would-be writer herself, accepts the position but is quickly dismayed by Owen's shabby work ethic and distracting visitors, including Ronnie (Keenan Wynn), his rowdy, mischievous neighbor. Despite their differing outlooks, Owen and Steve get married, but artistic and romantic jealousy just might tear them apart.

programme.title: The Last Horseman
programme.desc: A ranch foreman (Russell Hayden) and his buddies pose as women to get the jump on outlaws.

programme.title: The Son of Davy Crockett
programme.desc: President Ulysses S. Grant enlists a frontiersman's son to help insure the inclusion of Texas into the Union.

programme.title: In Old New Mexico
programme.desc: The Cisco Kid (Duncan Renaldo) and Pancho (Martin Garralaga) free a girl (Gwen Kenyon) accused of murder, then find the killer.

The crew on board the Nerka -- led by Lieutenant Jim Bledsoe (Burt Lancaster), who had been passed over for promotion when Richardson was brought in -- is openly hostile to their new commander, especially when it becomes clear that Richardson's sole obsession is finding and destroying the Japanese ship that sank his old vessel.

programme.title: The Last Horseman
programme.desc: A ranch foreman (Russell Hayden) and his buddies pose as women to get the jump on outlaws.

programme.title: The Son of Davy Crockett
programme.desc: President Ulysses S. Grant enlists a frontiersman's son to help insure the inclusion of Texas into the Union.

programme.title: The Cisco Kid in Old New Mexico
programme.desc: The Cisco Kid (Duncan Renaldo) and Pancho (Martin Garralaga) free a girl (Gwen Kenyon) accused of murder, then find the killer.

programme.title: Jubal
programme.desc: Searching for work, cowboy Jubal Troop (Glenn Ford) arrives in a small town, where he badly injures his hand. Fortunately, a local rancher, Shep Horgan (Ernest Borgnine), is willing to employ Troop despite the injury. Horgan and Troop work together amicably, but Horgan's two-timing wife (Valerie French) threatens to create discord when she becomes interested in Troop, although he really loves another woman. A jealous cowhand (Rod Steiger) complicates matters by spreading lies.

programme.title: The Last Challenge
programme.desc: Hotshot gunfighter Lot McGuire (Chad Everett) intends to make a name for himself by out-duelling legendary bandit-turned-lawman Marshal Dan Blaine (Glenn Ford). Before any bullets fly, however, Lot and his intended enemy strike up an unlikely friendship, and Blaine tries to convince the youngster to call off the shootout. Unfortunately, Lot can't be talked out of his quest for glory and so he guns down a few hostile locals, leaving Blaine no choice but to finally accept the offer for a showdown.

programme.title: Battle Stations
programme.desc: Crewmen (John Lund, William Bendix, Keefe Brasselle) of an Essex class aircraft carrier train for action in the Pacific, then come home.

programme.title: Dial M for Murder
programme.desc: Ex-tennis pro Tony Wendice (Ray Milland) wants to have his wealthy wife, Margot (Grace Kelly), murdered so he can get his hands on her inheritance. When he discovers her affair with Mark Halliday (Robert Cummings), he comes up with the perfect plan to kill her. He blackmails an old acquaintance into carrying out the murder, but the carefully-orchestrated set-up goes awry, and Margot stays alive. Now Wendice must frantically scheme to outwit the police and avoid having his plot detected.

programme.title: You Only Live Once
programme.desc: Joan Graham (Sylvia Sidney) works as the secretary to the public defender. Unfortunately, she's fallen madly in love with a criminal by the name of Eddie Taylor (Henry Fonda). Convinced that Eddie is a good man with bad luck, she pulls some strings and gets Eddie released from prison early. The two get married, but while Eddie tries to fly right, he soon discovers he can't change his nature. His past comes knocking at their door, and the couple is forced to go into hiding.

programme.title: Angel on My Shoulder
programme.desc: When a gangster, Eddie Kagle, is murdered by his childhood friend and business partner, Smiley Williams, he's sent to hell. There he meets Nick, who tries to get him to return to the living to take over the body of Judge Frederick Parker (also Muni). Kagle agrees, enticed by the prospect of seeking revenge on Smiley. But Kagel's attempts to tarnish Parker's reputation backfire, and when he finally confronts Smiley, his frustration has peaked.

programme.title: Robin Hood of Monterey
programme.desc: The Cisco Kid and Pancho set out to prove the innocence of a young rancher charged with murdering his father.

programme.title: Arizona Stagecoach
programme.desc: The Range Busters (Ray Corrigan, John King, Max Terhune) go after some bad guys.

programme.title: The Life and Legend of Wyatt Earp
programme.desc: Earp arrests the Kansas Kid, accused of robbery, murder, and wounding a deputy, but Earp is not convinced of the man's guilt or the sheriff's intentions.

programme.title: Ministry - Your Words Have Power with Joyce Meyer
programme.desc: Your words hold incredible power; today, Joyce reveals how the things you say can impact your life in profound ways.

programme.title: Word of God Ministries
programme.desc: Pastor James McMenis and his wife Chrissy are dedicated to winning the lost to Jesus and making disciples of the saved. Their goal is to bring clarity to the Word of God, making it life-applicable to people everywhere.

programme.title: The Catholic Mass
programme.desc: The Heart of the nation Sunday mass brings the beauty and traditions of the Catholic faith.

programme.title: Perry Stone
programme.desc: Religious teachings from Perry Stone.

programme.title: U.S. Mint Set Collection and Pure Gold Bars from CSN Mint!
programme.desc: Join your host Mike Mezack for this opportunity to get a 44 year run of United States Mint Sets as well as some Pure Gold Bars exclusively from CSN Mint!

programme.title: Battle Stations
programme.desc: Crewmen (John Lund, William Bendix, Keefe Brasselle) of an Essex class aircraft carrier train for action in the Pacific, then come home.

programme.title: Robin Hood of Monterey
programme.desc: The Cisco Kid and Pancho set out to prove the innocence of a young rancher charged with murdering his father.

programme.title: The Last Challenge

Before any bullets fly, however, Lot and his intended enemy strike up an unlikely friendship, and Blaine tries to convince the youngster to call off the shootout. Unfortunately, Lot can't be talked out of his quest for glory and so he guns down a few hostile locals, leaving Blaine no choice but to finally accept the offer for a showdown.

programme.title: Comanche Station
programme.desc: When solitary cowboy Jefferson Cody (Randolph Scott) hears tales of a white woman living as a captive of the Comanche tribe, he rides deep into the tribe's territory to exchange goods for her freedom. As Cody escorts the captive woman away, he learns that she is Nancy Lowe (Nancy Gates), and that there is a sizable reward offered by her husband for her return. Cody and Mrs. Lowe must brave ruthless bounty hunters greedy for the reward, as well as the now-warring Comanches, to make it to safety.

programme.title: Operation Pacific
programme.desc: In the South Pacific, submarine officer Duke Gifford (John Wayne) and the crew of the "Thunderfish" are attacked by the Japanese during a rescue mission, and their torpedoes malfunction. Returning safely to Pearl Harbor, Duke meets his ex-wife, Mary (Patricia Neal), who still feels strongly for him but is engaged to a pilot, the brother of Duke's commander, Pop Perry (Ward Bond). Determined to win Mary back, Duke is sidetracked when he and the crew are ordered on a mission with new torpedoes.

programme.title: In Harm's Way
programme.desc: Naval Captain Torrey (John Wayne) manages to bring his ship through the bombing of Pearl Harbor unscathed, but is later demoted when it is damaged in a subsequent battle due to his negligence. Back on land, he begins a reconciliation with his estranged son (Brandon de Wilde) and a romance with nurse Maggie (Patricia Neal), but duty calls him away when he and his firebrand friend, Cmdr. Paul Eddington (Kirk Douglas), are tasked with salvaging a dangerous and important mission.

programme.title: Henry V
programme.desc: Olivier's masterful, sweeping rendition of Shakespeare, filmed in rich color and ingeniously including a typical performance at the Globe Theatre as it might have been seen 400 years ago. The film earned Olivier a special Oscar for outstanding achievement as actor, producer and director.

programme.title: Christmas Mountain: The Story Of A Cowboy Angel
programme.desc: Inspired by an angel, an old cowboy (Slim Pickens) helps a widow and her children during the blizzard of '88.

programme.title: Riding the California Trail
programme.desc: The Cisco Kid (Gilbert Roland) and Pancho (Martin Garralaga) rescue a senorita.

programme.title: Through the Bible With Les Feldick
programme.desc: Les Feldick was an Oklahoma farmer and rancher with a special gift for teaching the Bible. His simple and nondenominational approach on the program "Through the Bible with Les Feldick" has reached millions around the world with the Gospel of Grace.

programme.title: The Life and Legend of Wyatt Earp
programme.desc: Ranchers are frustrated by the number of horse thefts near Wichita and want to blame a band of gypsies camped on Gus Cassen's property.

programme.title: The Casebook of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: Watson's encounter with Lady Frances Carfax brings Holmes rushing to the Lake District.

programme.title: Operation Pacific
programme.desc: In the South Pacific, submarine officer Duke Gifford (John Wayne) and the crew of the "Thunderfish" are attacked by the Japanese during a rescue mission, and their torpedoes malfunction. programme.title: Black Patch
programme.desc: A one-eyed marshal (George Montgomery) puts a bank-robbing buddy in jail, but two greedy locals try to get him out.

programme.title: The Verdict
programme.desc: Scotland Yard Superintendent George Edward Grodman (Sydney Greenstreet) is fired after an investigation he heads up results in the wrongful death sentence of an innocent man. Grodman's replacement is the arrogant John R. Buckley (George Coulouris), who haughtily delights in his sudden promotion. Wanting to spite Buckley while also finding redemption for his own mistake, Grodman teams up with artist Victor Emmric (Peter Lorre) to solve a mysterious new murder case.

programme.title: Sands of Iwo Jima
programme.desc: Marine Sgt. John Stryker (John Wayne) is despised by his own men for his rough attitude and exhausting training regimen. As the war in the Pacific progresses, though, they begin to respect Stryker's hard-edged outlook on war and his brutal training methods, as it has helped them prepare for the harsh realities of the battlefield. They'll need all of Stryker's battle tactics if they want to survive what will end up being one of the bloodiest engagements of the war: the Battle of Iwo Jima.

programme.title: Bad Blonde
programme.desc: An Italian boxing manager's (Frederick Valk) wife (Barbara Payton) tricks her heavyweight Irish lover (Tony Wright) into helping kill her husband.

programme.title: Too Late for Tears
programme.desc: A woman (Lizabeth Scott) kills her husband and plots with a private eye (Dan Duryea) after someone tosses a moneybag into her car.

programme.title: Pay Day
programme.desc: Charlie and his wife argue over his pay.

programme.title: Paid Programming
programme.desc: Paid programming.

programme.title: The Fatal Mallet
programme.desc: Three men play dirty tricks to charm a beautiful young woman.

programme.title: Movie
programme.desc: The Durango kid aims to break up Pop Ryland's gang of bank robbers but ends up saving the outlaw's son Tommy Ryland who has been marked for death.

programme.title: Through the Bible With Les Feldick
programme.desc: Les Feldick was an Oklahoma farmer and rancher with a special gift for teaching the Bible. His simple and nondenominational approach on the program "Through the Bible with Les Feldick" has reached millions around the world with the Gospel of Grace.

programme.title: The Life and Legend of Wyatt Earp
programme.desc: A pillar of the community is hailed as a hero when he shoots a thief, until people learn that the man is wanted for being a member of the James gang.

programme.title: The Casebook of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: Maria Gibson arranges to meet her children's governess at Thor Bridge, but is gunned down. The young governess is accused of murder, which forces her employer to enlist the aid of Sherlock Holmes.

programme.title: The Verdict
programme.desc: Scotland Yard Superintendent George Edward Grodman (Sydney Greenstreet) is fired after an investigation he heads up results in the wrongful death sentence of an innocent man. Grodman's replacement is the arrogant John R. Buckley (George Coulouris), who haughtily delights in his sudden promotion. Wanting to spite Buckley while also finding redemption for his own mistake, Grodman teams up with artist Victor Emmric (Peter Lorre) to solve a mysterious new murder case.

programme.title: Sands of Iwo Jima
programme.desc: Marine Sgt. John Stryker (John Wayne) is despised by his own men for his rough attitude and exhausting training regimen. As the war in the Pacific progresses, though, they begin to respect Stryker's hard-edged outlook on war and his brutal training methods, as it has helped them prepare for the harsh realities of the battlefield. They'll need all of Stryker's battle tactics if they want to survive what will end up being one of the bloodiest engagements of the war: the Battle of Iwo Jima.

programme.title: Satan's Cradle
programme.desc: The Cisco Kid (Duncan Renaldo) and Pancho (Leo Carrillo) flush out a crooked lawyer and his girlfriend (Ann Savage).

programme.title: Movie
programme.desc: The Durango kid aims to break up Pop Ryland's gang of bank robbers but ends up saving the outlaw's son Tommy Ryland who has been marked for death.

programme.title: Black Patch
programme.desc: A one-eyed marshal (George Montgomery) puts a bank-robbing buddy in jail, but two greedy locals try to get him out.

programme.title: Santa Fe
programme.desc: Three brothers become outlaws after the Civil War, while a fourth sibling goes to work for the railroad.

programme.title: Beachhead
programme.desc: During World War II, four Marines land on a Pacific island to execute the rescue of French planter Bouchard (Eduard Franz) and his daughter, Nina (Mary Murphy). With Japanese soldiers hidden throughout the dense jungle landscape, the Marines face a daunting trek to reach their target and must endure even greater danger on the return trip with the two French citizens. In the end, one of the Marines, Burke (Tony Curtis), carries the responsibility of getting everyone to safety.

programme.title: Casanova Brown
programme.desc: Casanova Brown (Gary Cooper) is about to marry Madge (Anita Louise) when he learns that his former wife, Isabel (Teresa Wright), has just had a baby that belongs to him, and plans to put the child up for adoption. Casanova runs out on the wedding, disguises himself as a doctor, visits the hospital where his infant daughter is being held and runs off with her to a hotel, where he does his best to care for the baby. Before long, Madge and Isabel hunt down Casanova, whom they are both furious with.

programme.title: How I Spent My Summer Vacation
programme.desc: Invited aboard a millionaire's (Peter Lawford) yacht, a young man (Robert Wagner) begins to suspect a conspiracy of murder.

programme.title: My Man Godfrey
programme.desc: Fifth Avenue socialite Irene Bullock needs a forgotten man to win a scavenger hunt, and no one fits that description more than Godfrey Park, who resides in a dump by the East River. Irene hires Godfrey as a servant for her riotously unhinged family, to the chagrin of her spoiled sister, Cornelia, who tries her best to get Godfrey fired. As Irene falls for her new butler, Godfrey turns the tables and teaches the frivolous Bullocks a lesson or two.

programme.title: South of Monterey
programme.desc: The Cisco Kid (Gilbert Roland), Pancho (Martin Garralaga) and a dancer try to outfox a swindler.

programme.title: Three Desperate Men
programme.desc: Three ex-lawmen Texas brothers become outlaws when one is framed for robbery and murder.

programme.title: Through the Bible With Les Feldick
programme.desc: Les Feldick was an Oklahoma farmer and rancher with a special gift for teaching the Bible. His simple and nondenominational approach on the program "Through the Bible with Les Feldick" has reached millions around the world with the Gospel of Grace.

programme.title: The Life and Legend of Wyatt Earp
programme.desc: Allen Pinkerton, hoping to recover stolen money, interferes in Earp's investigation of a murder in Wichita and gets the judge to pull Earp's badge.

programme.title: The Casebook of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: Holmes is consulted by a man who is concerned about the sudden strange behavior of his employer, who has taken to visiting a ruined crypt at nighttime, and bones are later discovered in his furnace.

programme.title: Beachhead
programme.desc: During World War II, four Marines land on a Pacific island to execute the rescue of French planter Bouchard (Eduard Franz) and his daughter, Nina (Mary Murphy). With Japanese soldiers hidden throughout the dense jungle landscape, the Marines face a daunting trek to reach their target and must endure even greater danger on the return trip with the two French citizens. In the end, one of the Marines, Burke (Tony Curtis), carries the responsibility of getting everyone to safety.

Dennis Gage, the handlebar mustachioed host, takes you along for the ride and keeps it entertaining with his unique perspective and enthusiasm for all things automotive. This show has something for everyone. From daily-drivers to Dusenberg's - from local cruise-ins to the most prestigious car shows in the world, this program covers it all!

programme.desc: Racing across America's best circuits, this division represents the highest echelon of GT racing in the country by exclusively using GT3 class cars competing in 90-minute races.

programme.title: 2025 Monster Jam Primetime
programme.desc: Stadium Championship Series West is back at Angel Stadium in Anaheim for Round 2 of the Monster Jam season. Ryan Anderson looks for his second straight event championship while Todd Leduc attempts to ride the freestyle winning wave to an overall event championship.

programme.title: 2025 Lucas Oil Late Model Dirt Series
programme.desc: These dirt warriors race machines on the cutting edge of technolog. They are not afraid to trade paint and race sideways, door-to-door in 64 events across 16 states for purses as high as $100,000.

programme.title: 2025 GT World Challenge America Highlights
programme.desc: Racing across America's best circuits, this division represents the highest echelon of GT racing in the country by exclusively using GT3 class cars competing in 90-minute races.

programme.title: 2025 Monster Jam Primetime
programme.desc: Stadium Championship Series West is back at Angel Stadium in Anaheim for Round 2 of the Monster Jam season. Ryan Anderson looks for his second straight event championship while Todd Leduc attempts to ride the freestyle winning wave to an overall event championship.

programme.title: Racers Roundtable With Danny Sullivan & Tony Stewart
programme.desc: What's it like to drive for Roger Penske? Go behind the curtain with Rusty Wallace, Sam Hornish Jr., & Ryan Newman.

programme.title: 2025 STARS National Series
programme.desc: The ASA STARS National Tour is back at the beautiful Owosso Speedway for the Michigan 200.

programme.title: 2025 Madera Racing
programme.desc: For 5 decades Madera Speedway has been a staple in the West Coast short track scene and each week we showcase up and coming stock car drivers who are looking to take the next step in their career.

programme.title: 2025 Isle of Man
programme.desc: Riders race through this legendary 37-mile course reaching speeds of over 200 miles per hour in a stunning display of skill and bravery in what has been deemed the most dangerous race in the world.

programme.title: 2025 Isle of Man
programme.desc: Riders race through this legendary 37-mile course reaching speeds of over 200 miles per hour in a stunning display of skill and bravery in what has been deemed the most dangerous race in the world.

programme.title: Racers Unchained
programme.desc: Paul Tracy sits down with Scott Dixon, the six-time IndyCar Series champion and 2008 Indianapolis 500 winner. Dixon shares insights from his illustrious career spanning over two decades with Chip Ganassi Racing.

programme.title: LOKAR Car Show
programme.desc: A bi-annual auto festival at Panama City Beach, Fla., is known as the South's Best Blast from the Past.

programme.title: Dealer Life
programme.desc: The day of the big ride arrives; hundreds of bikes bring excitement to the dealership as the team manages the unexpected crowd; Dan's friends, moonshiners Tim Smith and Josh Owens, join in on the ride through Bootlegger Country.

programme.title: Stacey David's GearZ
programme.desc: What do you get when you take a 4x4 diesel pickup, toss in over 2000hp and mix it with some serious bling? The definition of show and go! Stacey looks at a new twist on tool storage, and sets up a Jeep Gladiator for all your outdoor adventure needs!

programme.title: Sam's Garage
programme.desc: Sam builds a 347 stroker engine for a customer's 1966 Mustang.

programme.title: Racers Unchained
programme.desc: Paul Tracy sits down with Scott Dixon, the six-time IndyCar Series champion and 2008 Indianapolis 500 winner. Dixon shares insights from his illustrious career spanning over two decades with Chip Ganassi Racing.

programme.title: Prodigy Racing League
programme.desc: Drafted by Williams, G2, Guild, BS+, SuckerPunch, and Thibaut Courtois, 30 of the world's best gamers, from 100K+ who entered season 1, battle in the Prodigy Racing League. Only 20 advance to the next PRL series. This is the future of motorsports.

programme.title: 2025 FIM Sidecarcross
programme.desc: The FIM Sidecarcross riders race on the same tracks as solo motocross but the handling of machines differs as sidecars don't lean; skill meets speed, as they work together to navigate the courseand the fastest team wins.

programme.title: Racers Unchained
programme.desc: Paul Tracy sits down with Scott Dixon, the six-time IndyCar Series champion and 2008 Indianapolis 500 winner. Dixon shares insights from his illustrious career spanning over two decades with Chip Ganassi Racing.

programme.title: 2025 FIM Sidecarcross
programme.desc: The FIM Sidecarcross riders race on the same tracks as solo motocross but the handling of machines differs as sidecars don't lean; skill meets speed, as they work together to navigate the courseand the fastest team wins.

programme.title: 2025 Australian Superbike Championship
programme.desc: Since 1980, this championship has developed Australia's best road racers as they aspire to follow in the footsteps of legendary riders such as Troy Corser, Mat Mladin and Anthony Gobert.

programme.title: 2025 Isle of Man
programme.desc: Five classes. Ten races. Thirty-seven miles around one small island. Drivers risk it all at every one of the 200 dangerous turns chasing glory at speeds topping 200MPH in one of the most prestigious and challenging road races in the world.

programme.title: British Superbikes Motorcycle Racing
programme.desc: Highlights and coverage of the British Superbike action.

programme.title: King of the Roads
programme.desc: With riders racing through city streets on 200mph motorcycles with no margin for error, this series is the ultimate test for adrenaline junkies who are looking for the biggest thrill in motorsports.

programme.title: 2025 Australian Motocross Championship
programme.desc: The Australian Motocross series is sanctioned by Motorcycling Australia and runs through Fall and Winter featuring three classes; the premier class MX1 plus MX2, and MX3. The latter features junior riders. An MXW class for women is also part of the series.

programme.desc: Highlights and coverage of the British Superbike action.

programme.title: 2025 Monster Jam Primetime
programme.desc: The final showdown between JCB Digatron's Tristan England and Son-Uva Digger's Ryan Anderson leads to the crowning of the Stadium West Series Champion.

programme.title: Launch Control
programme.desc: The new season of Launch Control takes viewers behind the scenes of Subaru Motorsports USA. As the team prepares for a new season, take a look back at how the team has grown, and what's at stake moving forward.

programme.title: Hot Rod History Lessons
programme.desc: Uncover where synthetic oil actually came from. We're exploring a fighter jet pilot's path to pursue his vision to of how a jet fighter pilot pursued his vision to create a high-performing engine oil for automotive use.

programme.title: LOKAR Car Show
programme.desc: Bringing out all kinds of classics, customs and muscle cars to fill the streets of downtown Greenville, Pa..

programme.title: Dealer Life
programme.desc: Get to know Dan and the crew through a day in the life at a Harley-Davidson dealership; the crew rides over to Lucky's Saloon for Bike Night, sharing a glimpse of the rich culture behind the Harley-Davidson brand.

programme.title: Stacey David's GearZ
programme.desc: The Stunt Double is back in the shop for its much anticipated reveal and payoff! Inspired by the legendary FALL GUY truck, the Stunt Double is a ground up, frame off build of a classic square body Chevy truck that pays tribute to the stunt world.

programme.title: Sam's Garage
programme.desc: Sam installs the engine and transmission into the Summit Racing Bandit Project with some help from a young gearhead.

programme.title: 2025 Monster Jam - Arena in 30
programme.desc: Weston Anderson leads Team Grave Digger into a high energy battle for the event championship trophy on Arena Championship Series West.

programme.title: Jim Shockey's Hunting Adventures
programme.desc: If it's an animal roaming the wild, Jim Shockey has probably hunted it. The veteran wilderness guide and outfitter has tracked game in more than 40 countries and taken in excess of 300 species using bow, muzzleloader and rifle. In addition, Shockey has exclusive guiding territories on Vancouver Island, in the Yukon Territory, in Mexico's Sonoran Desert, and in his native Saskatchewan, all of which helps supply content for the hunting adventures seen in this award-winning series. Jim's daughter Eva, a full-fledged hunter in her own right, joins her dad on many episodes.

programme.desc: Even if YOU do everything right to protect yourself, company and institutional data breaches are out of your control. Nearly 1 out of 4 US consumers have been a victim of identity theft. Find out how LifeLock can help protect your identity.

programme.title: Think Big
programme.desc: Children are the future -- and so are their inventions, which is why "Think Big" could be an important show. It features young inventors competing to see who can come up with the most-innovative invention. Each episode features two teams in the Think Tank -- a studio filled with art supplies and construction materials -- who brainstorm and choose materials before sketching, designing and building a prototype to be presented to a judge, who determines a winner. The champions earn bragging rights and the coveted Genius Cup.

programme.title: Biz Kids

programme.title: America's Heartland
programme.desc: Much of the food Americans eat is produced by farmers and ranchers in the country's heartland, but many people don't know how it's produced. "America's Heartland" provides information about the people and processes responsible for the availability of food and fuel across the country and around the world. The show's reporters and producers tell stories in topics that include farm families, consumer issues, animal welfare and crop sustainability. Some episodes also take the show abroad to countries such as Egypt and Taiwan to show the impact American agriculture has on the global economy.

programme.title: Hellgate
programme.desc: After the Civil War, ranch owner Gil Hanley helps a stranger in desperate need of medical attention. Soon he is questioned by Union soldiers about the stranger, who turns out to be an ex-Confederate soldier. Hanley, also an ex-Confederate, is unjustly convicted as a conspirator and sentenced to life in a brutal desert prison in New Mexico. After battling his tough cellmate and a sadistic guard, Hanley tries to stop a plague from overwhelming the prison.

programme.title: Through the Bible With Les Feldick
programme.desc: Les Feldick was an Oklahoma farmer and rancher with a special gift for teaching the Bible. His simple and nondenominational approach on the program "Through the Bible with Les Feldick" has reached millions around the world with the Gospel of Grace.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S4 E2 Jim Beckwourth: The Long Ride Jim Beckwourth lives a life of adventure as a trapper, trader and adopted member of the Crow tribe. When America goes to war, Beckwourth becomes an army dispatch rider, a job that puts him and a young greenhorn on a collision course with the Pawnee.

programme.title: Wagon Train
programme.desc: S2 E1 The Flint McCullough Story Flint returns home to Fort Bridger to visit the man who raised him. A run-in with an enemy brings back painful memories of his time in the Confederate Army and the tragedy that ensued after falling in love with Jean Yates, a young Mormon.

programme.title: The Tall Tales of Jim Bridger
programme.desc: S1 E1 They Killed Me Frontiersman Jim Bridger spins an incredible tale to a group of settlers, claiming he was once killed by Blackfeet warriors yet somehow lived to tell the tale. They think he's joking, but Bridger soon proves that he really did rise from the dead.

programme.title: The Tall Tales of Jim Bridger
programme.desc: S1 E4 Brothers in Arms When they are ambushed by a Blackfeet war party, Jim Bridger and a lone Shoshone brave must work together to find a way to defeat their common enemy. If they can't overcome their suspicions and learn to trust each other, they may not survive the day.

programme.title: Vengeance Valley
programme.desc: A Colorado rancher contends with his two sons, one biological and the other adopted, who are fighting over control of the massive family property. Which brother will come out on top in this family battle for cash and cattle?

programme.title: The Quick and the Dead
programme.desc: A mysterious stranger crosses paths with a frontier family traveling to the Wyoming Territory. He becomes the family's defender against a ruthless gang bent on taking all they have and robbing them of their dreams, lives, and futures.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E3 The Blowout Al Walker, a sick gunslinger, comes to North Fork hoping to die in peace. Knowing that his presence will attract outlaws, Micah and Lucas put him in protective custody. When outlaws set fire to the town, Walker dies a hero by standing up to them.

programme.title: The Legend of 5 Mile Cave
programme.desc: A boy enchanted with tales from the Old West unlocks a mystery that could save their family farm. While his widowed mother struggles to avoid foreclosure, a mysterious stranger arrives looking for a room to rent. A bond with the boy grows as the drifter recounts breathtaking stories of Shooter Green, a legendary gunslinger accused of Arizona's biggest gold robbery. The truth is revealed, along with the secret of the drifter's past when a crooked lawman appears, hot on the trail of the stolen gold. Past and present collide in this tale of action, adventure and drama. Stars Adam Baldwin (The Last Ship, Full Metal Jacket, The Patriot), Jeremy Sumpter (Peter Pan, Soul Surfer), Jill Wagner (Braven, Christmas Cookies), and Jet Jurgensmeyer (Last Man Standing, American Sniper).

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E13 A Friend in Need A man named Carl Avery kidnaps Mark and demands a $5,000 ransom for his safe return. Lucas mortgages his ranch to a longtime friend for the money. When Lucas delivers the ransom, he discovers his friend is part of the disturbing kidnapping plot.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E22 Deadly Image A local rancher, who claims to be an eyewitness, accuses Lucas of murder. Townspeople are shocked until Earl Bantry, who looks like Lucas' twin, arrives in North Fork. Bantry, a ruthless criminal, threatens Mark and goes on a rampage against Lucas.

programme.title: Legends of the Pony Express
programme.desc: Heroic Pony Express riders and station keepers face deadly terrain, hostile Native Americans, and dangerous outlaws to deliver vital mail across the untamed frontier. Their life-and-death adventures unite the country and become the stuff of legends.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S1 E8 Dr. Susan Anderson: Frontier Medicine Woman Freshly-graduated from medical school, Dr. Susan Anderson sets up a practice in Cripple Creek, Colorado, a rough-and-tumble mining town. At a time when only ten percent of physicians are female, Dr. Anderson faces her share of doubters and has a difficult time attracting patients in the frontier town. When miners suddenly rush into her office with an injured boy, she defies prevailing wisdom and decides to save his mangled arm instead of amputating the limb. The risks are enormous. If the boy's arm becomes infected, and he dies, she will lose everything. Years later, Dr. Anderson relives the story while treating Bat Masterson, legendary gunfighter-turned-newspaperman, who comes down with fever while passing through Cripple Creek.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S1 E9 Elfego Baca & the Frisco Shootout Just days on the job and brandishing a homemade badge, nineteen-year-old Deputy Elfego Baca's courage is immediately put to the test. After arresting a drunken cowboy for shooting up a saloon, Baca faces down the cowboy's friends, who are hired guns for a wealthy rancher. He wins the first skirmish, but the cowboys return with reinforcements and the stage is set for the biggest and longest gunfight in Old West history. Baca seeks shelter in a small adobe house and makes his stand against a small army of men who shoot up the house with thousands of rounds of ammunition over the course of 33 hours. Years later, legendary gunfighter-turned-newspaperman Bat Masterson gets the real story of what comes to be known as the Frisco Shootout from the former sheriff who deputized Baca just prior to the legendary gun battle.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S4 E2 Jim Beckwourth: The Long Ride Jim Beckwourth lives a life of adventure as a trapper, trader and adopted member of the Crow tribe. When America goes to war, Beckwourth becomes an army dispatch rider, a job that puts him and a young greenhorn on a collision course with the Pawnee.

programme.title: Wagon Train
programme.desc: S2 E1 The Flint McCullough Story Flint returns home to Fort Bridger to visit the man who raised him. A run-in with an enemy brings back painful memories of his time in the Confederate Army and the tragedy that ensued after falling in love with Jean Yates, a young Mormon.

programme.title: The Tall Tales of Jim Bridger
programme.desc: S1 E1 They Killed Me Frontiersman Jim Bridger spins an incredible tale to a group of settlers, claiming he was once killed by Blackfeet warriors yet somehow lived to tell the tale. They think he's joking, but Bridger soon proves that he really did rise from the dead.

programme.title: The Tall Tales of Jim Bridger
programme.desc: S1 E4 Brothers in Arms When they are ambushed by a Blackfeet war party, Jim Bridger and a lone Shoshone brave must work together to find a way to defeat their common enemy. If they can't overcome their suspicions and learn to trust each other, they may not survive the day.

programme.title: Vengeance Valley
programme.desc: A Colorado rancher contends with his two sons, one biological and the other adopted, who are fighting over control of the massive family property. Which brother will come out on top in this family battle for cash and cattle?

programme.title: The Quick and the Dead
programme.desc: A mysterious stranger crosses paths with a frontier family traveling to the Wyoming Territory. He becomes the family's defender against a ruthless gang bent on taking all they have and robbing them of their dreams, lives, and futures.

programme.title: Blue Ridge
programme.desc: Ex-Green Beret, Justin Wise, trades in his life of danger for a sheriff badge in a sleepy town at the heart of the Blue Ridge Mountains. Now closer to his ex-wife and daughter, he's ready to settle down and embrace a life without chaos. But trouble has a way of following him. Just when he starts getting adjusted to the simple life, a murder in the community puts the residents on edge and refuels a longtime feud between two of the most powerful families. As Justin and his deputies work the case, he realizes there is more to his new home than meets the eye. Secrets unfold, and motives emerge, leading Justin on a race against time to solve the case before the townspeople take the law into their own hands.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E13 The Coward George Collins, a meek young man who loves to write, moves west for adventure. However, he is soon fired as a trail cook and beaten up by trailhands. Lucas takes George under his wing to help him discover his true qualities and inner strength.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E4 The Pitchman A fast-talking con man and his teenage son stop at Lucas McCain's Ranch and try to talk their way into securing the mineral rights. However, the plan backfires when they discover the gold they thought was on the property is actually fool's gold.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E9 The Long Goodbye Stubborn Grandpa Fogerty lives in a rundown house with his grandson, Woody. Lucas tries to get the old man to send the boy to school. The ladies of North Fork want Woody removed from the home and ask Lucas to help them.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E8 Mark's Rifle Marty Blair rides into North Fork to promote a circus coming out west from Ohio. Blair is soon under suspicion when there is an attempted robbery at the hotel. Mark finds it hard to believe that Blair is guilty, however, Lucas feels differently.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S1 E2 Jim Bridger: Forged on the Frontier With dreams of fortune and adventure, an 18-year-old Jim Bridger joins William Ashley's expedition to trap beaver along the Missouri River. But a grim ordeal soon forces Bridger to weigh his morals against the harsh reality of survival in the wild. A vicious grizzly bear attack leaves fellow trapper and hunter Hugh Glass on the verge of death and completely dependent upon Bridger's care. As a hostile band of Arikara warriors begins to close in, Bridger must choose between staying with the dying man and risking certain death, or leaving his injured comrade alone in the woods and fleeing to safety. In what becomes a legendary tale of the wild frontier, Bridger wrestles to choose between right and wrong, knowing the harsh retribution that will follow if he makes the wrong choice.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S1 E10 Bat Masterson & the Dodge City Dead Line: Part 1 Legendary gunfighter-turned-newspaperman Bat Masterson looks back on his time as sheriff of Dodge City when he and Wyatt Earp worked together to bring law and order to the notorious frontier town. As they struggle to pacify the rowdy cowhands passing through town, the two men draw their own proverbial line in the sand. South of the railroad track that splits the town, they let the cowboys run wild. But on the north side, they outlaw all guns in an effort to create a zone of civility. When a troublemaker crosses this dead line with his gun, it sets off a chain reaction of violence that endangers the town's beloved entertainer, the celebrated singer Dora Hand.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S1 E11 Bat Masterson & the Dodge City Dead Line: Part 2 Legendary gunfighter-turned-newspaperman Bat Masterson looks back on his time as sheriff of Dodge City when he and Wyatt Earp worked together to bring law and order to the notorious frontier town. As they struggle to pacify the rowdy cowhands passing through town, the two men draw their own proverbial line in the sand. South of the railroad track that splits the town, they let the cowboys run wild. But on the north side, they outlaw all guns in an effort to create a zone of civility. When a troublemaker crosses this dead line with his gun, it sets off a chain reaction of violence that ends the life of the town's beloved entertainer, the celebrated singer Dora Hand. After tracking down her killer, Masterson shoots him in the arm as he tries to escape. When the judge learns there are no witnesses, however, he sets the killer free due to lack of evidence, leaving Masterson with a moral dilemma. Does he seek revenge or await the slow

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S6 E6 Retaliation Sheriff Cheyenne Bodie is out of town visiting widow Cora Ainslie and her son Bart. A group of men robs the bank and blows up a train trestle while he is away. Cheyenne discovers that banker Thackery Smith rules the town, and many are not happy.

programme.title: Wagon Train
programme.desc: S3 E1 The Malachi Hobart Story Duke scouts a new passage through rough terrain. He meets a traveling preacher named Malachi Hobart during his trip. However, he soon discovers that Hobart is nothing more than a con man. Duke devises a plan to expose him.

programme.title: Rio Diablo
programme.desc: When a just-married couple is caught in the middle of a bank robbery, the bride is taken by the robbers. Now, the groom and a skilled bounty hunter search for the gang, hoping to find the bride alive.

programme.title: The Proud Rebel
programme.desc: A Confederate veteran battles prejudice and greed as he helps a woman save her ranch from a land grab, while searching for a cure for his mute son.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E3 Lou Mallory Lou Mallory, a beautiful red-headed lady, arrives in North Fork and quickly buys property, including Milly Scott's general store. Lucas learns she is quite the businesswoman, until she gets into trouble.

programme.desc: Ex-Green Beret, Justin Wise, trades in his life of danger for a sheriff badge in a sleepy town at the heart of the Blue Ridge Mountains. programme.title: Wagon Train
programme.desc: S3 E1 The Malachi Hobart Story Duke scouts a new passage through rough terrain. He meets a traveling preacher named Malachi Hobart during his trip. However, he soon discovers that Hobart is nothing more than a con man. Duke devises a plan to expose him.

programme.title: Rio Diablo
programme.desc: When a just-married couple is caught in the middle of a bank robbery, the bride is taken by the robbers. Now, the groom and a skilled bounty hunter search for the gang, hoping to find the bride alive.

programme.title: The Proud Rebel
programme.desc: A Confederate veteran battles prejudice and greed as he helps a woman save her ranch from a land grab, while searching for a cure for his mute son.

programme.title: Rage at Dawn
programme.desc: In 1866, the Reno Brothers gang is ravaging Indiana. When a detective agency sends a man to infiltrate the gang by posing as an outlaw, he sets a trap to capture the gang during an early-morning train robbery.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S1 E1 John Colter: King of the Mountain Men As a member of Lewis and Clark's Corps of Discovery, John Colter travels from the Missouri River all the way to the Pacific Ocean, but he decides not to return to the civilized East when the expedition ends. Entranced by the beauty and adventure of the wild frontier, he becomes one of America's first mountain men. As a hunter, trapper and explorer in his own right, he's the first American to see the Grand Tetons and the epic Yellowstone Valley. While his epic explorations make him famous, it's a harrowing ordeal with Blackfeet warriors that makes him a legend. After boldly venturing into territory controlled by the Blackfeet tribe, Colter is captured, stripped naked, and forced to run for his life as warriors give chase in what will come to be known as Colter's Run.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S1 E5 Kit Carson: The Greatest Scout in the West As a fur trapper, hunter, scout, and explorer, Kit Carson is an irresistible subject for reporters and novelists, and his incredible adventures make him a mythic figure in his own lifetime. Yet fame is the last thing on Carson's mind in 1849. All he wants to do is settle down to a quiet life with his wife on the family ranch, but once again fate comes calling. When settler Ann White is captured by an Apache raiding party, the Army seeks out Carson to help track the warriors and rescue Mrs. White, whose husband was killed in the raid. Although known to be the best tracker in the history of the Western Frontier, Carson admits this is the most difficult trail he has ever followed. He leads the military on a desperate chase, tracking the Apache through 200 miles of treacherous western wilderness. When they finally catch up with the Apache, the aftermath leaves Carson haunted for the rest of his days.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S1 E3 The Great Train Robbery Bat Masterson, former gunfighter and sheriff, is now working as a newspaperman. He heads west again to uncover the story behind one of the country's greatest train robberies. Although Butch and Sundance are long gone, Masterson tracks down Sundance's former girlfriend, Etta Place, to draw out more details. To pull off the audacious robbery, they used official Union Pacific lanterns to signal the train and fool the engineer into believing a bridge was out. As Etta reluctantly relives the events of the robbery and its aftermath, it's obvious that she is still smitten by Sundance after all of these years.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S1 E7 Wild Bill Hickok & the First Quick-Draw Duel Wild Bill Hickok and his buddy, Davis Tutt, see their friendship fall apart over gambling debts and the affections of a beautiful woman. After Tutt swipes Wild Bill's prized timepiece as payback for a disputed debt, things begin to heat up. Then, when Tutt parades through town with the watch in one hand and Hickok's former girlfriend in the other, Wild Bill's blood begins to boil. Tutt refuses to return the watch, and he continues to flaunt the beautiful woman on his arm. The two men meet in the middle of town to settle their differences once and for all in what will become the very first quick-draw duel of the Old West. Both men reach for their pistols at the same time and fire! In an attempt to separate the truth from the fiction, Bat Masterson, legendary gunfighter-turned-newspaperman, interviews George Ward Nichols, the journalist who immortalized the duel and created the legend of Wild Bill Hickok.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S1 E8 Jedediah Smith: Scholar and Survivor A young Jedediah Smith joins William Ashley's expedition and helps establish the fur trade along the Missouri River, but it's not hunting or trapping he longs for...it's adventure. Inspired by Lewis and Clark, he wants to explore the vast, uncharted American frontier. Trekking through unknown and unforgiving terrain, Smith's iron will and unwavering courage under fire help him survive a vicious grizzly bear attack, hostile Native Americans, and life-or-death periods of starvation, dehydration, and exhaustion. During his incredible journeys, he becomes the first non-Native American to cross the Mojave Desert into California, the first to navigate through the perilous Sierra Nevada Mountains, and the first to traverse the Great Basin Desert. He ultimately sees more of the American West than any other adventurer, including Lewis and Clark, and opens the frontier in a way that no other mountain man can claim.

programme.title: The Last Days of Frank and Jesse James
programme.desc: When the famous James brothers give up robbing banks and attempt to live as reputable gentleman farmers, they are soon forced to seek revenge on the men who bomb their mother's house, crippling her, and killing their stepbrother.

programme.title: Sitting Bull
programme.desc: A U.S. Cavalry officer begins to understand the plight of the Sioux and arranges a meeting between Chief Sitting Bull and President Grant.

programme.title: Abilene Town
programme.desc: It's the late 1800s and a marshal must stop a volatile and growing conflict between homesteaders and cattle drivers in his small town on the Kansas frontier.

programme.title: Rage at Dawn
programme.desc: In 1866, the Reno Brothers gang is ravaging Indiana. When a detective agency sends a man to infiltrate the gang by posing as an outlaw, he sets a trap to capture the gang during an early-morning train robbery.

programme.title: The Last Days of Frank and Jesse James
programme.desc: When the famous James brothers give up robbing banks and attempt to live as reputable gentleman farmers, they are soon forced to seek revenge on the men who bomb their mother's house, crippling her, and killing their stepbrother.

programme.title: Sitting Bull
programme.desc: A U.S. Cavalry officer begins to understand the plight of the Sioux and arranges a meeting between Chief Sitting Bull and President Grant.

programme.title: Abilene Town
programme.desc: It's the late 1800s and a marshal must stop a volatile and growing conflict between homesteaders and cattle drivers in his small town on the Kansas frontier.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S3 E1 My Heart's in Alabama It's time for the cowboys to ride into new pastures as they explore growing their cattle business in unexpected ways. Bubba has been making good money working for his father-in-law's company in Mississippi, but he realizes he'd rather be out of his office chair and back on his horse in Alabama. Cody is excited to be managing a big rodeo, but a steer mishap puts the future of his contract on the ropes. And, even though Booger has happily saddled up with Jaclyn, it's unfamiliar terrain for him when she starts adding a woman's touch to his bachelor pad. As the three cowboys get together to sort yearlings for a friend, they devise a plan for making BBQ sauce to expand their cooking skills and company.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S3 E2 There's No Place Like Home Booger and Cody team up to pen a herd of cattle, but a stubborn cow takes refuge in a fishing hole, requiring some creative wrangling. The stress of maintaining a long-distance relationship leads Bubba and Kaley to move back to Alabama for good. Booger embraces his new role as a family man and enlists young Matthew to help surprise Jaclyn with a much needed home-improvement project. Cody helps Misty throw a beef-tasting party for potential buyers. As the guys ponder using their cowboy skills to open a steak house, they decide to get some on-the-job training by working a shift during the hectic dinner rush at a local eatery.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E1 The Sharpshooter Lucas McCain and his son, Mark, arrive in North Fork to purchase a ranch. When Lucas enters a turkey shoot to win money for a down payment, he soon finds himself at odds with town villain Jim Lewis.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E2 Home Ranch After Lucas buys his ranch, hired hands of a wealthy cattleman demand he leave. When Lucas refuses, the men beat him, drag him, and then they burn his ranch house to the ground. Lucas tracks these men down and confronts their boss, Oat Jackford.

programme.title: They Call Me Trinity
programme.desc: When a land-hungry rancher sends his bullies to harass peace-loving Mormons into giving up their fertile valley, a lazy gunfighter with a very quick draw and amazing accuracy, along with his horse-thieving brother, come to the settlers' rescue.

programme.title: The Deadly Companions
programme.desc: When a former Army officer accidentally kills a woman's young son, he offers to escort the grieving mother through dangerous Indian territory on the way to lay the boy to rest at the family homestead.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S3 E17 The Road Not Taken Jimmy is hot on the trail of a killer that he has personal reasons for taking down. Jesse decides to tag along. Meanwhile, back at the station, the other riders are upset with Cody about a published story he wrote about them.

programme.title: The Proud Rebel
programme.desc: A Confederate veteran battles prejudice and greed as he helps a woman save her ranch from a land grab, while searching for a cure for his mute son.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E5 The Brother-In-Law Mark's uncle, Johnny Gibb, a famous rodeo rider, comes to visit. Mark idolizes his uncle, but Lucas soon discovers that Johnny is on the run from the law after robbing an express office, and is afraid that Johnny is a bad influence on young Mark.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E6 Eight Hours to Die Corrupt Judge Burton seeks justice against those who are responsible for the hanging of his son, including Lucas McCain, who caught him. When Burton discovers that Lucas has a son, he captures Lucas to make him watch Mark suffer the same punishment.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E7 Duel of Honor Italian Count Alfredo Di Montova comes to North Fork. His unique clothing attracts the attention of town bully Sim Groder. When Groder pushes the count too far, Montova initiates a duel, and asks Lucas to assist with the rules.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E8 The Safe Guard A new bank opens in North Fork, and banker John Hamilton hires Floyd Doniger for security. However, problems arise when robbers who followed the new safe into town discover their old pal Floyd is the bank guard.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S3 E3 Man Down! Bubba's back in the saddle with the guys when his horse bucks and throws him on a bone-breaking fall, fractures his cowboy spirit and immobilizes his work with the cattle company. Booger enlists a bullfighter to help him wrangle his ornery Brahman cattle, and considers whether or not he has enough land to maintain the growing herd. Misty gives Cody a gift from the heart that captures both their past as a couple and honors their growing family legacy as ranchers. The guys pitch each other competing ideas for their future steakhouse, and Cody's brainstorm stands out as the one with true cowboy vision - including a name for their venture.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S3 E4 Filet of Dreams Bubba's in a pinch when Cody urges him to ease his aching back with acupuncture. Cody and Misty have to find out why their herd is losing so many stillborn calves before it threatens their new business. Booger discovers the ups and downs of daddy duty when he takes care of Matthew for the day. He draws on the bonding time he had with his own grandfather to make a special new memory. The cowboys put their steakhouse dreams on the line to recruit a business partner and are confronted with their next steps: developing a full menu and creating a pop-up restaurant.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E3 End of a Young Gun A young outlaw named Will Fulton saves Mark's life but breaks a leg in the process. He mends at Lucas' ranch, and there meets the lovely Ann Bard. The outlaw begins to soften and reassesses his choices and path in life.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E4 The Marshal Micah Torrance, formerly a famous marshal, who is now a drunk crippled from a gunfight, stumbles into North Fork. Lucas McCain hires him in hopes of rehabilitating the man. The good deed quickly backfires when outlaws arrive.

programme.title: The Tall Tales of Jim Bridger
programme.desc: S1 E2 The Spirit of Truth After his fur trapping expedition is surprised by a Crow war party, legendary mountain man Jim Bridger suddenly finds himself in a desperate struggle to rescue his fellow trappers when one of them goes missing, and another is on the brink of madness.

programme.title: The Tall Tales of Jim Bridger
programme.desc: S1 E3 The Fossil Feud When bloodthirsty Canadian trappers try to kill him, mountain man Jim Bridger takes cover in an unexplored valley. There, he runs headlong into a family of escaped slaves who show him the huge footprints and fossilized bones of long-dead monsters.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S1 E10 Bat Masterson & the Dodge City Dead Line: Part 1 Legendary gunfighter-turned-newspaperman Bat Masterson looks back on his time as sheriff of Dodge City when he and Wyatt Earp worked together to bring law and order to the notorious frontier town. As they struggle to pacify the rowdy cowhands passing through town, the two men draw their own proverbial line in the sand. South of the railroad track that splits the town, they let the cowboys run wild. But on the north side, they outlaw all guns in an effort to create a zone of civility. When a troublemaker crosses this dead line with his gun, it sets off a chain reaction of violence that endangers the town's beloved entertainer, the celebrated singer Dora Hand.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S1 E11 Bat Masterson & the Dodge City Dead Line: Part 2 Legendary gunfighter-turned-newspaperman Bat Masterson looks back on his time as sheriff of Dodge City when he and Wyatt Earp worked together to bring law and order to the notorious frontier town. As they struggle to pacify the rowdy cowhands passing through town, the two men draw their own proverbial line in the sand. South of the railroad track that splits the town, they let the cowboys run wild. But on the north side, they outlaw all guns in an effort to create a zone of civility. When a troublemaker crosses this dead line with his gun, it sets off a chain reaction of violence that ends the life of the town's beloved entertainer, the celebrated singer Dora Hand. After tracking down her killer, Masterson shoots him in the arm as he tries to escape. When the judge learns there are no witnesses, however, he sets the killer free due to lack of evidence, leaving Masterson with a moral dilemma. Does he seek revenge or await the slow

programme.title: Christmas on the Range
programme.desc: Despite constant threats from her ambitious neighbor, Kendall Riley fights heroically to save the family ranch. In a surprising turn of events, Clint McCree, a veterinarian and her neighbor's son, arrives on the scene to deliver a calf from a cow having trouble giving birth. Gradually, a romance blossoms, until her neighbor's henchmen scatter Kendall's herd and she wonders if Clint's concern is genuine or if he is part of his family's effort to sabotage her land. Filled with action, adventure, and emotion, this modern-day Western provides an engaging tribute to small towns, big dreams and the power of love. Stars Erin Cahill (Saving Grace, Red Widow, Sleepy Hollow), Nicholas Gonzalez (The Good Doctor, Walker Texas Ranger), A Martinez (Longmire, The Cowboys, Days of our Lives), and Lindsay Wagner (The Bionic Woman, Grey's Anatomy).

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S3 E18 The Sacrifice Teaspoon and Jimmy travel to help restore order in a lawless town that The Kid and Lou happen to be visiting. Along their way, they encounter a runaway slave. Meanwhile, a robbery occurs in the town, and The Kid takes over for the sheriff.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S2 E4 The Bounty Killers After the marshal who saved Cheyenne's life deputizes him, they travel together to Kansas to bring a prisoner to justice. However, Cheyenne begins to have second thoughts when he learns of the marshal's reputation and practices.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S2 E5 The Law Man Cheyenne heads out to investigate a cattle rustling problem. When he arrives, he learns that the local ranchers and his longtime friend have already solved the problem. He decides to investigate further and renews an old friendship with his mentor.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E9 The Sister Rebecca Snipe returns to North Fork after an extended visit. Lucas' son Mark is smitten and plans to play matchmaker for his dad. However, the Snipe brothers get involved to make sure Lucas is good enough for Rebecca.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E10 New Orleans Menace Wealthy Frenchman Cesar Tiffauges, who is used to getting whatever he desires, wants to buy the McCain Ranch. Tiffauges, a sadistic man, abuses his followers regularly with beatings. When Lucas refuses, his son Mark becomes the object of cruelty.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E11 The Apprentice Sheriff Dan Willard fills in as deputy while Marshal Micah Torrance is away on business. Meanwhile, Texas cowhands come to town looking for fun and relaxation. When Dan tries to prove that his toughness, those actions backfire.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E12 The Angry Gun Lucas and Mark, returning after selling their herd, share the stagecoach trip with a marshal and his prisoner, Johnny Cotton. Johnny's gang stops and robs the stagecoach, while Johnny steals Lucas' gun and profits. Lucas is forced to track him down.

programme.title: The Virginian

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.desc: A ruthless gunman, out to defy law and order, comes up against Matt Dillon.

programme.title: Hatfields and McCoys: Bad Blood
programme.desc: A Union soldier on his way home runs afoul of Jim Vance and his nephew Ellison Hatfield, and as confederate sympathizers, they're furious with the idea of one of their neighbors fighting for the Union.

programme.title: Kansas Pacific
programme.desc: With the American Civil War looming, construction of the Pacific railroad is being held up in Kansas, sabotaged by Confederate sympathizers. The government dispatches an Army engineer, John Nelson (Sterling Hayden), to oversee construction, and he initially rubs the wrong way both his proud boss (Barton MacLane) and his boss's feisty daughter (Eve Miller). Eventually, though, both fall for Nelson's charms, and the hero seeks to uncover the Southern rat so he can lead the Union men due west.

programme.title: Tales of Wells Fargo
programme.desc: Hardie guns down an ex-convict during an attempted hold-up.

programme.title: The Legend of 5 Mile Cave Promo
programme.desc: A woman takes in an aging boarder who begins to tell her son fanciful tales of gun fighting adventures and hidden treasure; when outsiders come to town looking for him, they begin to realize there may be some truth to the legend.

programme.title: The High Chaparral
programme.desc: Victoria and Wind are among the hostages of an outlaw (Edmond O'Brien) whose bank-robbery plans go awry.

programme.title: Laramie
programme.desc: When a cattleman who double-crossed Slim is later found dead, Slim becomes the prime suspect in the man's death.

programme.desc: With Pastor Steve Munsey.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: After Lucas kills a mountain man in a barroom brawl, his father arrives in North Fork determined to take revenge on Lucas and Marshal Torrance, once he breaks his other two boys out of jail.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: A dying gunslinger attracts trouble to North Fork.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: A newspaper reporter believes his wife is involved with Lucas.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas and Mark lie to protect a dead man's family.

programme.title: The High Chaparral
programme.desc: Buck offers his help and a proposal of marriage when he falls for the head (Joanna Moore) of a troubled freight company.

programme.title: The High Chaparral
programme.desc: An Apache once saved by Victoria drags her to his camp and orders her to cure his chief's injured son.

programme.title: Two Mules for Sister Sara
programme.desc: When gunslinger Hogan (Clint Eastwood) discovers a group of men attempting to rape a young nun, Sara (Shirley MacLaine), he shoots them dead and rescues the woman. The two escape to a nearby camp of Mexican revolutionaries, who have hired Hogan to help fight the invading French army. En route, Sara turns out to be surprisingly crude for a nun, drinking, smoking and using curse words. When she also proves to be handy with a gun, Hogan begins wondering if she is telling him the whole truth.

programme.title: The Good, the Bad and the Ugly
programme.desc: In the Southwest during the Civil War, a mysterious stranger, Joe (Clint Eastwood), and a Mexican outlaw, Tuco (Eli Wallach), form an uneasy partnership -- Joe turns in the bandit for the reward money, then rescues him just as he is being hanged. When Joe's shot at the noose goes awry during one escapade, a furious Tuco tries to have him murdered. The men re-team abruptly, however, to beat out a sadistic criminal and the Union army and find $20,000 that a soldier has buried in the desert.

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.desc: A gunman arrives in Dodge determined to enhance his reputation by outdrawing Matt in a gunfight.

programme.title: El Dorado
programme.desc: Heartless tycoon Bart Jason (Edward Asner) hires a group of thugs to force the MacDonald family out of El Dorado so he can claim their land. J.P. Harrah, the town's sheriff, is too deep in the throes of alcoholism to help the family. When Harrah's friend, noble elder gunfighter Cole Thorton (John Wayne), learns of the predicament, he travels to El Dorado with his upstart friend, Mississippi (James Caan), to help Harrah clean up in time for a shootout against Jason's men.

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.desc: A plainsman helps in the hunt for his son, who has been accused of murder.

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.desc: Dodge City merchants hire a meek constable without realizing the consequences.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: After a gang beats him, Ike becomes depressed about his handicap until a terminally ill boy teaches him a valuable lesson about life.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: When a prisoner (Billy Joe Patton) mysteriously dies, the riders go under cover to expose a corrupt sheriff.

programme.title: Laramie
programme.desc: Jess is unwittingly riding shotgun on a payroll stage that has been rigged to wreck; after the robbery, Jess trails the bandits to Billings.

programme.title: Laramie
programme.desc: An ex-con from Slim's past shows up on the ranch, seeking assistance from Slim, who grudgingly agrees to help.

programme.title: Mike Murdock - School of Wisdom
programme.desc: Biblical principles of wisdom that help individuals face life's successes.

programme.title: David Jeremiah
programme.desc: In this weekly program, Dr. David Jeremiah delivers practical messages to the congregation at the Shadow Mountain Community Church in San Diego. Also featured is music from the Shadow Mountain Community Church Choir and Orchestra, as well as performances by musical guests that have included Steve Green and Charles Billingsley. Men and women who have been impacted by the Turning Point ministry also share their stories with viewers. During the month of December, "Turning Point" usually features special Christmas programming.

programme.title: Forgotten Jews
programme.desc: Join the International Fellowship of Christians and Jes to east suffering of elderly Jews in war-torn Ukraine and provide a survival food box. Save Holocaust survivors who can't afford both food and medicine.

programme.title: The Rate Escape: Cut Bills Up To Half!
programme.desc: Paying too much for cell service? Kari Byron takes on the world of Big Wireless! Find out how you can save up to HALF on your monthly cell phone bill and get great service. Stop overpaying. Say goodbye to that big bill from Big Wireless!

programme.title: Gunsmoke

programme.title: Walk the Proud Land
programme.desc: Based on a true story, this film follows John Philip Clum (Audie Murphy), a government official sent to Arizona to broker peace between the Americans and the Apache people. Initially hesitant, the Americans are convinced by Clum to stop fighting, and they allow him to establish a police force on the reservation, trained by Clum's friend Tom Sweeny (Charles Drake). Meanwhile, a romantic rivalry begins between Clum's wife and an Apache woman (Anne Bancroft) who has taken refuge in Clum's home.

programme.title: America's Court With Judge Ross

programme.title: America's Court With Judge Ross
programme.desc: Americans just can't get enough courtroom drama, as is evidenced by yet another addition into the daytime court show fray. programme.title: The Verdict With Judge Hatchett
programme.desc: Judge Glenda Hatchett presided over her self-titled courtroom show from 2000-2008. Now, she returns to the medium with "The Verdict." In the half-hour series, the Atlanta native and former juvenile-court judge rules over small-claims cases brought in front of her. Hatchett's courtroom isn't just about finding someone guilty, though. She also uses her experience dealing with young people and her tough-love approach to help send a message to out-of-control juvenile offenders to try to set them on the right track in their lives.

programme.title: Supreme Justice With Judge Karen
programme.desc: Karen Mills was a county court judge and criminal defense attorney in Florida before turning to TV to preside over her own court shows. In her third effort, "Supreme Justice," Mills tackles small-claims court arbitrations in her compassionate way, to which viewers of her previous shows have grown accustomed. As usual with court shows, cases involve friendships gone bad, money disputes and property damage.

The former Los Angeles-based prosecutor takes on the typical cases that are found on TV court shows. The arbitrator says that her show "will be life because everything we do, it involves the law."

programme.title: America's Court With Judge Ross
programme.desc: Americans just can't get enough courtroom drama, as is evidenced by yet another addition into the daytime court show fray. Former judge and prosecutor Kevin Ross adjudicates real cases, in which he tries to show litigants alternative ways of dealing with their issues and make them consider the consequences of their actions.

programme.title: America's Court With Judge Ross
programme.desc: Americans just can't get enough courtroom drama, as is evidenced by yet another addition into the daytime court show fray. Former judge and prosecutor Kevin Ross adjudicates real cases, in which he tries to show litigants alternative ways of dealing with their issues and make them consider the consequences of their actions.

programme.title: The Verdict With Judge Hatchett
programme.desc: Judge Glenda Hatchett presided over her self-titled courtroom show from 2000-2008. Now, she returns to the medium with "The Verdict." In the half-hour series, the Atlanta native and former juvenile-court judge rules over small-claims cases brought in front of her. Hatchett's courtroom isn't just about finding someone guilty, though. She also uses her experience dealing with young people and her tough-love approach to help send a message to out-of-control juvenile offenders to try to set them on the right track in their lives.
